p.span: The context is a 'Data Driven' context. If the type is 'average_centered', the fields avg, count, and size must be passed in via the search stream. If the type is 'domain', the fields count, max and min must be passed in via the search stream. If the type is 'median_centered', the fields median, count and size must be passed in via the search stream. See xsCreateUDContext for details about creating a User Defined Context instead of data from a search.

xsCreateDDContext name=string terms="string(,string)*" count=int [appendclass=(true|false)] [class="string(,string)*"] [container=string] [endshape=(curve|linear)] [notes=string] [read=string] [save=(true|false)] [scope=(private|app|global)] [search=string] [shape=(pi|trapezoid|triangle|curveincrease|curvedecrease|linearincrease|lineardecrease)] (type=average_centered | type=domain | type=median_centered) [uom=string] [write=string]

index=demographics | stats count(Height) as count avg(Height) as avg stdev(Height) as size by Gender | xsCreateDDContext name=Height container=Height class=Gender scope=global terms="short,medium,tall" shape=pi endshape=curve type=average_centered uom=inches

Creates average_centered contexts (Height, Height/Male, Height/Female), centered at 0, with 3 terms (short, medium, tall) with count, avg and size passed in the search stream, using inches as the unit of measure (UOM).

| index=demographics | stats count(Height) as count min(Height) as min max(Height) as max by Gender | xsCreateDDContext name=Height container=Height class=Gender scope=global terms="short,medium,tall" shape=pi endshape=curve type=domain uom=inches search="index=demographics" appendclass=true

Creates domain contexts (Height, Height/Male, Height/Female) with terms (short, medium, tall) with count, min, and max passed in the search stream, the unit of measure is inches. The search field is set to "index=demographics Gender="Male" " or "index=demographics Gender="Female" " depending on the context/class. The default class has search="index=demographics".
class, container, endshape, name, notes, read, scope, search, shape, terms, type, uom, write
A comma separated list of classes.
The container to store the context.
The shape of the end concepts. This defaults to curve.
A legal string which specifies the name by which the created Context will be known.
A description of the context. This defaults to 'none'.
Read permissions (i.e., roles) . This defaults to * (for all roles).
Save the context after it is created. The default value is "true". To turn off save, set save=false.
Where to save the context (private, app, global). This defaults to global.
The search string used to generate data
The shape of the middle concepts. This defaults to pi.
A comma delimited set of legal strings which define the names of the terms within the Context.
average_centered' - centers the context on the average and uses size. to scale term sizes
domain - the default, centers the set on (max-min)/2 and scales the context to cover the whole domain
Write permissions (i.e., roles) . This defaults to * (for all roles).

The context created by xsCreateDDContext is displayed in table or chart format. See xsDisplayContext for details about display of the created Context.
See xsCreateUDContext for details about creating a Context using a 'generating' command instead of a 'streaming' command.
